member.name: T:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker
member.summary: Represents an object that enforces thread affinity for a Windows Script engine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker.CheckAccess
member.summary: Determines whether the calling thread has access to the script engine.
member.returns: True if the calling thread has access to the script engine, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker.VerifyAccess
member.summary: Enforces that the calling thread has access to the script engine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker.Invoke(System.Action)
member.summary: Invokes a delegate that returns no value on the script engine's thread.
member.param: The delegate to invoke on the script engine's thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker.Invoke``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Invokes a delegate that returns a value on the script engine's thread.
member.param: The delegate to invoke on the script engine's thread.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.NullSyncInvoker
member.summary: Provides a null implementation.
member.remarks: This class does not enforce thread affinity and should be used with caution. Windows Script engines can behave unpredictably when thread affinity is violated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.NullSyncInvoker.Instance
member.summary: The sole instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.NullSyncInvoker.CheckAccess
member.summary: Determines whether the calling thread has access to the script engine.
member.returns: True if the calling thread has access to the script engine, false otherwise.
member.remarks: The implementation of this method always returns true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.NullSyncInvoker.VerifyAccess
member.summary: Enforces that the calling thread has access to the script engine.
member.remarks: The implementation of this method performs no action.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.NullSyncInvoker.Invoke(System.Action)
member.summary: Invokes a delegate that returns no value on the script engine's thread.
member.param: The delegate to invoke on the script engine's thread.
member.remarks: The implementation of this method invokes without synchronization.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.NullSyncInvoker.Invoke``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Invokes a delegate that returns a value on the script engine's thread.
member.param: The delegate to invoke on the script engine's thread.
member.remarks: The implementation of this method invokes without synchronization.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.JScriptEngine
member.summary: Represents an instance of the JScript engine.
member.remarks: This class can be used in non-desktop environments such as server applications. An implementation of is required to enforce thread affinity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.JScriptEngine.#ctor(Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new JScript engine instance.
member.param: An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.JScriptEngine.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new JScript engine instance with the specified name.
member.param: A name to associate with the instance. Currently this name is used only as a label in presentation contexts such as debugger user interfaces.
An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.JScriptEngine.#ctor(Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new JScript engine instance with the specified options.
member.param: A value that selects options for the operation.
An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.JScriptEngine.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new JScript engine instance with the specified name, options, and synchronous invoker.
member.param: A name to associate with the instance. Currently this name is used only as a label in presentation contexts such as debugger user interfaces.
A value that selects options for the operation.
An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.JScriptEngine.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new JScript engine instance with the specified programmatic identifier, name, list of supported file name extensions, options, and synchronous invoker.
member.param: The programmatic identifier (ProgID) of the JScript engine class.
A name to associate with the instance. Currently this name is used only as a label in presentation contexts such as debugger user interfaces.
A semicolon-delimited list of supported file name extensions.
A value that selects options for the operation.
An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.
member.remarks: The argument can be a class identifier (CLSID) in standard GUID format with braces (e.g., "{F414C260-6AC0-11CF-B6D1-00AA00BBBB58}").

member.name: P:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.JScriptEngine.FileNameExtension
member.summary: Gets the script engine's recommended file name extension for script files.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.JScriptEngine.ExecuteCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Executes script code as a command.
member.param: The script command to execute.

remarks.para: This method is similar to but optimized for command consoles. The specified command must be limited to a single expression or statement. Script engines can override this method to customize command execution as well as the process of converting the result to a string for console output.
The version of this method attempts to use toString to convert the return value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.VBScriptEngine
member.summary: Represents an instance of the VBScript engine.
member.remarks: This class can be used in non-desktop environments such as server applications. An implementation of is required to enforce thread affinity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.VBScriptEngine.#ctor(Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new VBScript engine instance.
member.param: An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.

member.summary: Initializes a new VBScript engine instance with the specified name.
member.param: A name to associate with the instance. Currently this name is used only as a label in presentation contexts such as debugger user interfaces.
An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.VBScriptEngine.#ctor(Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new VBScript engine instance with the specified options.
member.param: A value that selects options for the operation.
An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.VBScriptEngine.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new VBScript engine instance with the specified name, options, and synchronous invoker.
member.param: A name to associate with the instance. Currently this name is used only as a label in presentation contexts such as debugger user interfaces.
A value that selects options for the operation.
An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.VBScriptEngine.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new VBScript engine instance with the specified programmatic identifier, name, list of supported file name extensions, options, and synchronous invoker.
member.param: The programmatic identifier (ProgID) of the VBScript engine class.
A name to associate with the instance. Currently this name is used only as a label in presentation contexts such as debugger user interfaces.
A semicolon-delimited list of supported file name extensions.
A value that selects options for the operation.
An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.
member.remarks: The argument can be a class identifier (CLSID) in standard GUID format with braces (e.g., "{F414C260-6AC0-11CF-B6D1-00AA00BBBB58}").

member.name: P:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.VBScriptEngine.FileNameExtension
member.summary: Gets the script engine's recommended file name extension for script files.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.VBScriptEngine.ExecuteCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Executes script code as a command.
member.param: The script command to execute.

remarks.para: This method is similar to but optimized for command consoles. The specified command must be limited to a single expression or statement. Script engines can override this method to customize command execution as well as the process of converting the result to a string for console output.

The version of this method supports both expressions and statements. If the specified command begins with "eval " (not case-sensitive), the engine executes the remainder as an expression and attempts to use CStr to convert the result value. Otherwise, it executes the command as a statement and does not return a value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine
member.summary: Provides the core implementation for all Windows Script engines.
member.remarks: This class can be used in non-desktop environments such as server applications. An implementation of is required to enforce thread affinity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags,Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.ISyncInvoker)
member.summary: Initializes a new Windows Script engine instance with the specified list of supported file name extensions and synchronous invoker.
member.param: The programmatic identifier (ProgID) of the Windows Script engine class.
A name to associate with the instance. Currently this name is used only as a label in presentation contexts such as debugger user interfaces.
A semicolon-delimited list of supported file name extensions.
A value that selects options for the operation.
An object that enforces thread affinity for the instance.
member.remarks: The argument can be a class identifier (CLSID) in standard GUID format with braces (e.g., "{F414C260-6AC0-11CF-B6D1-00AA00BBBB58}").

member.name: P:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.SyncInvoker
member.summary: Gets the implementation associated with the current script engine.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.CheckAccess
member.summary: Determines whether the calling thread has access to the current script engine.
member.returns: True if the calling thread has access to the current script engine, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.VerifyAccess
member.summary: Enforces that the calling thread has access to the current script engine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.HostWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets an interface that supports the display of dialogs on behalf of script code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.Script
member.summary: Allows the host to access script resources directly.
member.remarks: The value of this property is an object that is bound to the script engine's root namespace. It dynamically supports properties and methods that correspond to global script objects and functions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.GetStackTrace
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the script call stack.
member.returns: The script call stack formatted as a string.

remarks.para: This method returns an empty string if the script engine is not executing script code. The stack trace text format is defined by the script engine.
The version of this method returns the empty string if script debugging features have not been enabled for the instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.Interrupt
member.summary: Interrupts script execution and causes the script engine to throw an exception.
member.remarks: This method can be called safely from any thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.CollectGarbage(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs garbage collection.
member.param: True to perform exhaustive garbage collection, false to favor speed over completeness.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Core.WindowsScriptEngine.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the script engine and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: True to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
member.remarks: This method is called by the public method and the Finalize method. invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the parameter set to true. Finalize invokes Dispose(Boolean) with set to false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.IHostWindow
member.summary: Allows Windows Script engines to display dialogs within the host's user interface.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.IHostWindow.OwnerHandle
member.summary: Gets the handle of an owner window for displaying dialogs on behalf of script code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.IHostWindow.EnableModeless(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables the host's modeless dialogs.
member.param: True to enable the host's modeless dialogs, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.IWindowsScriptObject
member.summary: Represents a Windows Script object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.IWindowsScriptObject.GetUnderlyingObject
member.summary: Provides access to the underlying unmanaged COM object.
member.returns: An object that represents the underlying unmanaged COM object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Nothing
member.summary: Represents an empty object reference.
member.remarks: When passed to a Windows Script engine, an instance of this class is marshaled as an empty variant of type VT_DISPATCH. VBScript interprets this as the special object reference Nothing. In JScript it appears as a value that is equal to, but not strictly equal to, undefined.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Nothing.Value
member.summary: The sole instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.Nothing.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.
member.returns: A string that represents the current object.
member.remarks: The version of this method returns "[nothing]".

member.name: T:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags
member.summary: Defines options for initializing a new Windows Script engine instance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.None
member.summary: Specifies that no options are selected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.EnableDebugging
member.summary: Specifies that script debugging features are to be enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.EnableJITDebugging
member.summary: Specifies that Just-In-Timestamp script debugging is to be enabled. This option is ignored if is not specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.DisableSourceManagement
member.summary: Specifies that smart source document management is to be disabled. This option is ignored if is not specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.EnableStandardsMode
member.summary: Specifies that script language features that enhance standards compliance are to be enabled. This option only affects .

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.MarshalNullAsDispatch
member.summary: Specifies that null is to be marshaled as a variant of type VT_DISPATCH. This option does not affect field, property, or method return values declared as , , nullable , or nullable numeric types.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.MarshalDecimalAsCurrency
member.summary: Specifies that values are to be marshaled as variants of type VT_CY.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.MarshalArraysByValue
member.summary: Specifies that managed arrays that are passed or returned to script code are to be converted to script arrays and marshaled as variants of type VT_ARRAY. In VBScript these objects are the native array type. JScript code can use the VBArray object to access them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.DoNotEnableVTablePatching
member.summary: When is specified, the ClearScript library uses virtual method table patching to support JScript-specific IDispatchEx extensions that otherwise interfere with some host object functionality. Virtual method table patching is a very low-level mechanism with global effect. This option specifies that virtual method table patching is not to be enabled on behalf of the current instance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ClearScript.Windows.WindowsScriptEngineFlags.MarshalDateTimeAsDate
member.summary: Specifies that values are to be marshaled as variants of type VT_DATE. In VBScript these objects are the native date-time type. JScript code can pass them to the Date constructor for property access.
